suncertify.api
Interface DBConnection

All Known Subinterfaces:
RemoteDBConnection
All Known Implementing Classes:
DBConnectionImpl
public interface DBConnection

Main database interface exposing create/update/delete/find functionalities. It also exposes access to metadata of the database contained in the database file.

Author:
Szymon Bochniak (bochniak.szymon@gmail.com)

Method Detail

createRecord

long createRecord(Contractor contractor)
                  throws DuplicateKeyException,
                         java.io.IOException
Stores a Contractor entity in the database.

Parameters:
contractor - entity to be stored
Returns:
row number of the stored entity.
Throws:
DuplicateKeyException - if an attempt was made to store an entity with already existing key.
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurred while accessing the database.

readRecord

Contractor readRecord(long recNo)
                      throws RecordNotFoundException,
                             java.io.IOException
Reads an entity from the database for a given row number.

Parameters:
recNo - row number of an entity to read.
Returns:
entity from the database in recNo position.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - if the database has no row on position recNo, or that row was marked as deleted.
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurred while accessing the database.

updateRecord

void updateRecord(long recNo,
                  Contractor record)
                  throws RecordNotFoundException,
                         SecurityException,
                         java.io.IOException
Updates an entity in the database a the given position with a given data. Null values in updating record will not change the database values.

Parameters:
recNo - row number of an entity to update.
record - data to update row with.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - if the database has no row on position recNo, or that row was marked as deleted.
SecurityException - if there was a problem with locking the row for update.
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurred while accessing the database.

deleteRecord

void deleteRecord(long recNo)
                  throws RecordNotFoundException,
                         SecurityException,
                         java.io.IOException
Deletes an entity at the given position from the database.

Parameters:
recNo - row number of an entity to delete.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - if the database has no row on position recNo, or that row was marked as deleted.
SecurityException - if there was a problem with locking the row for delete.
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurred while accessing the database.

findByCriteria

java.util.List<Contractor> findByCriteria(Contractor criteria,
                                          boolean exactMatch)
                                          throws java.io.IOException
Finds entities by the given search criteria. Null value in criteria object matches any text string. There are two search modes possible:
    exact match - Each field of database entity needs to be either equal to corresponding criteria field or null to match the criteria;
    contain match Each field of database entity needs to either contain a value of corresponding criteria field or be null to match the criteria.

Parameters:
criteria - search criteria
exactMatch - true if search is to be done in 'exact match' mode. false for 'contain match' mode.
Returns:
List of entities matching the criteria.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurred while accessing the database.
